question_text: Which of the following is a key visual difference between AC and DC on electrical diagrams?
answer_options: AC is shown with a dotted line; DC is solid
AC is shown with a wavy line; DC is straight
DC is shown with a sine wave; AC is flat
AC is red; DC is blue
correct_answer: AC is shown with a wavy line; DC is straight
explanation: AC current is often illustrated with a sine wave or wavy line, while DC is represented with a flat, straight line.
